meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The humbuggers tried to sell fake watches to unsuspecting tourists.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of humbuggers who claimed to have magical powers.
meanings.sent3: The humbuggers at the fair pretended to be fortune tellers for fun.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his disguise and realized he was just a humbugger in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The humbuggers in the story always wore masks to hide their true identities.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to him; he's just spouting humbuggers.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement was full of humbuggers to lure in customers.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the teacher's silly humbuggers during class.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with humbuggers to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent5: The book was entertaining with its mix of truth and humbuggers throughout.

meanings.sent1: He tried to humbugger his way out of trouble by making up excuses.
meanings.sent2: The con artist humbuggered the old lady into giving him all her savings.
meanings.sent3: She humbuggered her brother into believing he had superpowers for a day.
meanings.sent4: The magician humbuggered the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The fox humbuggered the rabbit into thinking they were friends before pouncing.
